activities.loc: Courtroom E, Fourth Floor - South Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kierra Montreal Bommer

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on November 30, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:10 AM Prosecuting attorney Cheniqua White in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kierra Montreal Bommer appeared by video.  Attorney Eric Caudill, for attorney Glenn Edward Avena appeared by video for Kierra Montreal Bommer. Not guilty plea entered.

Adjourned initial appearance on August 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:42 AM  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared by video supervising intern Verity Altenberger by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kierra Montreal Bommer appeared by phone. Defendant requests more time to get an attorney.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Activity: Initial appearance 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

10:04 AM Defendant Kierra Montreal Bommer in court by audio.  Noah M Tylenda appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant address and date of birth verified.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  Signature bond set of $1000 with conditions. No possession of weapons during the pendency of this case. Defendant must sign bond on June 15, 2022 between 12 PM and 1 PM.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 10:00 AM.
No possession of any weapons during pendency of case.
Initial appearance on June 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
